p: Unlike hepatitis B virus infection, arthralgias, rashes, vasculitis, and glomerular nephritis are uncommon with acute hepatitis A. Extrahepatic manifestations include myocarditis, renal failure, optic neuritis, transverse myelitis, polyneuritis, and cholecystitis. Aplastic anemia and red cell aplasia may occur. Autoimmune hepatitis has also been described following infection with this virus.
